info.headline: Wind Advisory issued September 9 at 1:02PM PDT until September 11 at 2:00AM PDT by NWS Phoenix AZ
info.description:
* WHAT...West to southwest winds 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 45 mph expected.
* WHERE...Southwest corner of Imperial County.
* WHEN...For the first Wind Advisory, from 6 PM this evening to 6 AM PDT Wednesday. For the second Wind Advisory, from 6 PM Wednesday to 2 AM PDT Thursday.
* IMPACTS...Difficult driving conditions, especially for larger vehicles traveling along roads with crosswinds. Light, unsecured objects may become airborne.
info.instruction:
A Wind Advisory means that sustained wind speeds of between 30 and 40 mph are expected, or wind gusts of between 40 and 58 mph. Winds this strong can make driving difficult, especially for high profile vehicles.
In addition, strong winds over desert areas could result in briefly lowered visibilities to well under a mile at times in blowing dust or blowing sand. Use extra caution.

parameter.value: WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO 6 AM PDT WEDNESDAY... ...WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM WEDNESDAY TO 2 AM PDT THURSDAY
